name: ENIAC Unveiled
description: The ENIAC, the first general-purpose electronic computer, was publicly unveiled in 1946, marking a significant leap in computing technology.

name: ARPANET Goes Live
description: In 1969, the ARPANET sent its first message between UCLA and Stanford, laying the foundation for the modern internet.

name: Apple I Released
description: Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs introduced the Apple I in 1976, one of the first personal computers with a single circuit board.

name: IBM PC Launched
description: IBM entered the personal computer market in 1981 with the IBM 5150, setting standards for PC architecture.

name: Windows 95 Release
description: Microsoft's launch of Windows 95 in 1995 was a major milestone in GUI-based computing, attracting global attention.

name: Google Founded
description: In 1998, Larry Page and Sergey Brin founded Google, revolutionizing how people search and access information online.

name: YouTube Launched
description: YouTube's debut in 2005 changed the digital media landscape, becoming the largest video-sharing platform in the world.

name: ChatGPT Unleashed
description: OpenAI released ChatGPT in 2022, showcasing the power of large language models in everyday applications.
